pr_title: Add transformer that removes trait definitions

timeline.author: mtdowling

replies.bodyText: Fixed.  This evolved a bit and I didn't update the naming.
replies.author: srchase

replies.bodyText: This should probably be a ProjectionTransformer and not a SmithyBuildPlugin since it needs to modify a model and not necessarily create its own artifacts.
replies.author: mtdowling

replies.bodyText: This has been reworked and is now a transformer.
replies.author: srchase

timeline.bodyText: This probably doesn't need the BackwardCompatHelper since it's new.
timeline.author: mtdowling

timeline.bodyText: I don't see how this would work if, say, a trait shape is removed that is a structure that references other shapes that were removed. It might be better to instead filter before removing trait shapes rather than re-add. (e.g., maybe you can add a Predicate to the getModelWithoutTraitShapes method.
timeline.author: mtdowling
mtdowling

@@ -387,6 +406,20 @@ public Model scrubTraitDefinitions(Model model) {
      * @return Returns a model that contains matching shapes.

     public Model getModelWithoutTraitShapes(Model model) {
+        return getModelWithoutTraitShapes(model, FunctionalUtils.alwaysTrue());
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Gets all shapes from a model where shapes that define traits or shapes
+     * that are only used as part of a trait definition have been removed.
+     *
+     * @param model Model that contains shapes.
+     * @param keepFilter Predicate function that accepts a trait shape (that
+     *  has the {@link TraitDefinition} trait) and returns true to remove the
+     *  definition or false to keep the definition in the model.base.

timeline.bodyText: Can this filtering be done all on a single stream instead of needing to make two sets?
